result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto Silvestre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable court costs and sucrhages by the end of probation in 14CF5479.   Cash bail in 14CF2938 to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court finds the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample, due to financial hardship, surcharge waived.

Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, straight time, consecutive with credit for 179 days time served.
Consecutive to:
As a convicted felon, defendant may never possess firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberto Silvestre

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roberto Silvestre in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Roberto Silvestre in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, straight time, consecutive with credit for 179 days time served.  
*
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of probation in 14CF5479.  Cash bail in 14CF2938 to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.   Court finds the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, due to financial hardship, surcharge waived, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.  Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Roberto Silvestre not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Judge Dallet could not be her today and has heard sentencing statements already.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letters, copies of police reports, restraining order and pictures received and filed.  rmm
from Elida T. received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm

Defendant Roberto Silvestre in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Roberto Silvestre in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Andrea L.  Court ordered matter adjourned so defendant can get letters that he would like the Court to see.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Roberto Silvestre not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for sentencing hearing. Court is in jury trial. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
(3) in support of the defendant received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Roberto Silvestre in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Roberto Silvestre in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
Defendant's Response to State's Motion to Admit Hearsay Statements Under Doctrine of Forefeiture by Wrongdoing received and filed.  rmm
State's Motion to Admit Testimonial Statements of Elida Tejeda Under Forfeiture by Wrongdoing received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm

Defendant Roberto Silvestre in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Final Pretrial held.  State to file forfeiture by wrong doing motion, to be file with the Court by 03-20-2015; defense to respond by 04-10-2015. Court will address on trial date. Case remains set for jury trial on 04-13-2015 in Branch 40. Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Roberto Silvestre in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Roberto Silvestre in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. On motion of the state, Court ordered 14CF2938, 14CF5479 and 15CF57 joined for the purpose of trial.    Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ELIDA T.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Roberto Silvestre in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Roberto Silvestre in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
